table.name: mem
table.column: نقشه کشیدن، طرح ریزی کردن، برنامه ریزی کردن
This word is used for the planning of an event, a battle strategy, etc., but not for the designing of a physical object (the word for that is {ren:v}).
Это слово использовано для планирования события, стратегии боя, и т.д.,но не для планирования какого-то физического объекта. Для этого, используйте слово {ren:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the planning of an event, and not to the plan of a physical object (i.e., a blueprint, which would be a {pu'jIn:n}).
Это слово относится к планированию события, а не физического объекта (например чертежа, для которого более подходящее слово {pu'jIn:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is never followed by the locative suffix {-Daq:n:suff}. ({TKD 3.3.5:src})
Это слово никогда не следует за локационным суффиксом {-Daq:n:suff}. ({TKD 3.3.5:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: There is a typo in {TKD:src}, an extra space after {naDev:sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a command given to an animal (or a subordinate) to fetch an object. It is in clipped Klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: Sie wissen nicht, dass wir hier sind.
آنها نمی دانند ما اینجا هستیم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
De vet inte att vi är här. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Они не знают, что мы здесь
他們不知道我們在這裡。
Eles não sabem que estamos aqui.
This line was cut from {Star Trek V:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: هیچ چیز در اینجا اتفاق نمی افتد [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: کلینگان ها در اینجا وجود دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ta avstånd ifrån, avslå, förkasta, förebrå

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the act of undoing someone's discommendation ({naDHa'ghach:n}).
Это является актом отмены чьего-то осуждения ({naDHa'ghach:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined as "rock, stone" in {TKD:src} and as "ceramic material" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: stone panel (artwork, similar to a painting)
پانل سنگ (آثار هنری، شبیه به نقاشی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
石板（藝術品、類似於繪畫） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
painel de pedra (obras de arte, semelhante a uma pintura)
This literally means "flat rock", but the meaning has been extended to include artwork carved, incised, or painted onto it. See {mIllogh:n} for a more general word for "picture".

table.name: mem
table.column: This takes the plural suffix {-Du':n:suff}, whether the shell is still on the animal or not. But if the shell (off the animal) is broken up, and a piece or pieces of it are used for something, then the plural takes {-mey:n:suff}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the raised edge of a road or street.

table.name: mem
table.column: Known types of gemstones include {qevaS:n}, {Separ:n}, {DItlhon:n}, and {patmor:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: By itself, {naH:n} usually refers to {Du' naH:n} rather than {naH tlhab:n}.[2]
Сам по себе, {naH:n} обоычно относится к {Du' naH:n} больше, чем {naH tlhab:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiom refers to one's youthful days (a time before reaching an age considered appropriate for marriage). It was first spoken by {tlhI'yopatra':n:name}, in the play {'antonI' tlhI'yopatra' je:sen:nolink} by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}. In the popular Federation Standard version of the play, this is translated as "salad days".
▶ {naH jajmeywIj betleH vIyanbe'.:sen:nolink} "In my vegetable days, I did not wield a bat'leth."

table.name: mem
table.column: faca de legumes, faca de frutas (faca pequena)
There is an idiom, {jejHa'; naH taj rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to fruits or vegetables not grown on a farm, as opposed to {Du' naH:n}.[1, p.89]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is also spelled {neHjej:n:nolink}.
Do not confuse this word with {naQjej:n}.

In the body text of {KGT:src}, this word is spelled {naHjej:n:nolink}, with a note that it literally means "sharp fruit".[1, p.88] However, it is spelled {neHjej:n:nolink} in both the E-K and K-E word lists.

table.name: mem
table.column: One typically {choptaH:v} on the nut, then {tlhIS:v} the pieces of shell.[1, p.87]

table.name: mem
table.column: 是敵對的、惡意的、不友好的、敵對的 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The first half of the example sentence was a lip-match for the beginning of {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}. The creation of this word may also have been influenced by its similarity to {naS:v} and {natlh:v:2}.
▶ {ghach jIvvo' naH. DaH pIghvamDaq So''eghtaH.@@ghach:v, jIvvo':n, naH:v, DaH:adv, pIgh:n, -vam:n, -Daq:n, So':v, -'egh:v, -taH:v} "There is a criminal hiding in these ruins."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can take the content or subject matter of a dream as an object.[2]
Этот глагол может принимать содержимое или объект мечтания в качестве объекта.[2]
The nouns {Suchtuv:n:hyp} and {luvnup:n:hyp} and the verb {'ergh:v:hyp} were rumoured to have been revealed at {qep'a' 26 (2019):src}, but have not been officially confirmed.

table.name: mem
table.column: It seems that this word is composed of {nal:n:hyp}, a component found also in {loDnal:n} and {be'nal:n}, and {qaD:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: the familiar beginning of a song
o começo familiar de uma música
After hearing just this short portion of the beginning of the song, a listener will recognize the tune.

table.name: mem
table.column: holka ur, gröpa ur, gräva ur

table.name: mem
table.column: usar o quarto dedo do pé

table.name: mem
table.column: {HQ 10.2:src} says that this refers to "a particularly effective martial arts kick".
It's not entirely clear whether this is a verb or a noun.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara fullständig, vara hel, vara total, vara komplett
быть полным, быть целым(всеобъемлющим), быть законченным

The verb {naQmoH:v@@naQ:v, -moH:v} is used for filling out forms (see {yu'muD:n}).
Note that when {naQ:v:nolink} is used adjectivally, it means "a complete X". Compare this to {Hoch:n} following a noun, which means "all of X".

Глагол {naQmoH:v@@naQ:v, -moH:v} использован для заполнения форм (see {yu'muD:n}).
Заметьте, что когда {naQ:v:nolink} использован в качестве прилагательного, это значит "законченный X". Сравните это с {Hoch:n} который следует за существительным, который означает "все из X".
▶ {cha' choQmey naQ tu'lu' 'ej tep choQ bIngDaq lo' law' bID choQ tu'lu':sen:nolink} "2 Full Decks and a Half Utility Deck under the Cargo Deck"[2]
▶ {cha' choQmey naQ tu'lu' 'ej tep choQ bIngDaq lo' law' bID choQ tu'lu':sen:nolink} "Две полных палубы и вполовину полезная палуба под грузовой отсек"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined as "cain, staff" in {TKDA:src}, but "cain" appears to have been a misspelling of "cane". It was subsequently glossed as "stick" in {HQ 12.2:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This may have originated with the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect's pronunciation of {DaQ:n}.[1, p.154]

table.name: mem
table.column: چوب (مورد استفاده برای ضربه زدن به ابزار کوبه ای) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pinne (används för att slå på slaginstrument)
палка (использована для игры на ударном иструменте)
bastão (usado para golpear instrumento de percussão)

table.name: mem
table.column:
Parts of a spear are its shaft {tIH:n:2} and its spearhead {QIn:n:2}. Types of spears include {ghIntaq:n:1} and {chonnaQ:n}.
Do not confuse this word with {naHjej:n}.

Частями копья являются древко {tIH:n:2} и наконечник копья {QIn:n:2}. Типы копьев включают в себя {ghIntaq:n:1} и {chonnaQ:n}.
Не путайте это слово с {naHjej:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This isn't a word for Klingon weaponry, it's what a Klingon would call the projectile ammunition (e.g., from Earth).

table.name: mem
table.column: The Federation Standard name for this animal, "brush devil", has nothing to do with the Klingon name.
Der deutsche Begriff "Bürstenteufel" hat nichts mit dem klingonischen Namen zu tun.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is used idiomatically with {'eb:n} to describe missed or lost opportunities.[4]
Этот глагол использован идиоматически с {'eb:n} чтобы описать упущенные или потерянные возможности.[4]
▶ {ghe'torvo' narghDI' qa'pu':sen}[2] ▶ {HeghDI' SuvwI' nargh SuvwI' qa'.:sen}[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: If the warrior's spirit has not escaped, the battle is still going on.
Wenn der Geist eines Kriegers nicht enflohen ist, dauert die Schlacht noch an.
اگر روح جنگجو فرار نکرده است، نبرد هنوز ادامه دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Om krigareens ande inte har runnit, fortsätter striden fortfarande. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Если дух воина не ушел, битва по прежнему продолжается
如果戰士的靈魂沒有逃脫，戰鬥仍在繼續。
Se o espírito do guerreiro não escapou, a batalha ainda continua.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara illvillig, vara elak, vara hätsk, vara rasande
There is an idiom, {naS; norgh rur@@naS:v, norgh:n, rur:v}.[1, p.132]
Есть идиома, {naS; norgh rur@@naS:v, norgh:n, rur:v}.[1, p.132]

table.name: mem
table.column: sista posten i en lista, slutet på en lista
This is a special term for the last item in a list, which can be used in place of, e.g., {mu' HochDIch:n@@mu':n, HochDIch:n} for a list of words.

table.name: mem
table.column: sista posten i en lista, slutet på en lista
It is unclear if {tlhuch:v} "exhaust" means "to use something up completely".

table.name: mem
table.column: be reprehensible, be disgusting, be contemptible
widerlich, tadelnswert, verachtenswert, schändlich, anstößig sein
قابل تحسین، نفرت انگیز، تحقیر آمیز باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara förkastlig, vara äcklig, vara vidrig, vara usel, vara
應該受到譴責、噁心、卑鄙 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser repreensível, ser nojento, ser desprezível
In its slang meaning, this verb does not take an object.[1, p.155]

table.name: mem
table.column: A piece of paper has two {Dopmey:n@@Dop:n, -mey:n}.
This was originally defined as just "paper"[1], but was expanded to mean "sheet of paper" as well later.[4]
▶ {Quj wa'DIch MONOPOLY Huch nav qa' tlhIngan QaS:sen:nolink} "Klingon forces replace original MONOPOLY bills"[3]
▶ {Quj wa'DIch MONOPOLY Huch nav qa' tlhIngan QaS:sen:nolink} "Клингонские силы заменяют оригинальные счета Монополии"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: نامه (پیام بر روی کاغذ نوشته شده است) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: In context, {vaH:n} by itself is enough.

table.name: mem
table.column: A {nawlogh:n:nolink} may or may not belong to a {yo':n}.
{nawlogh:n:nolink} может или не может принадлежать к {yo':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: tillträda, komma åt, ha tillgång till
In {TKD:src}, this word is listed as a noun in the E-K side, and as a verb in the K-E side.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {TKD:src}, this word is listed as a noun in the E-K side, and as a verb in the K-E side.

table.name: mem
table.column: از راه دور، کوچک، محل خالی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
NowWhat is a planet in {The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ازدواج کنید (همسر این کار را انجام می دهد) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
{naychuq:v@@nay:v, -chuq:v} would be understood as a same-sex marriage between two women.[2]
{naychuq:v@@nay:v, -chuq:v} может быть понято, как брак между двумя женщинами.[2]
MO confirmed at {qep'a' 4 (1997):src} that {Saw:v:nolink} and {nay:v:nolink} come from "sure" and "no" said with a Southern drawl.

table.name: mem
table.column: The chemical symbol for the element sodium is Na, from the Latin "natrium".

table.name: mem
table.column: be sure, be definite, be positive, be certain
مطمئن باشید، مطمئن باشید، مثبت باشید، مطمئن باشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara säker, vara helt säker, vara viss
ter certeza, ser definitivo, ser positivo,

table.name: mem
table.column: This fruit is sweet. {na'ran rur} describes something sweet in taste.
The Sanskrit word for orange is "naarang".

table.name: mem
table.column: "Neb" is an old English word for "nose", which is related to the modern word "nib".

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to nozzles on rockets, hoses, etc., and takes the plural suffix {-mey:n}, as the connection to the body part has been lost.[1] (This is an exception to the general pattern of words for body part retaining the suffix {-Du':n} when they are used to refer to other things, as the non-body-part meaning of this word has become lexicalized.[2])

table.name: mem
table.column: This is associated with ritual and honor, and is much more than just a repository.
Dies ist in Verbindung mit Ehre und Zeremonie, und nicht nur ein Behälter.

table.name: mem
table.column: seitlich, von der Seite, seitwärts bewegen
سمت چپ، حرکت به سمت چپ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara sidoställd, vara placerad åt/vid sidan, röra sig i sidled,
быть боковым, двигаться боком, двигаться горизонтально, быть горизонтальным

table.name: mem
table.column: The meaning of this word is similar to that of {QaS:n:1h}, but it includes officers ({yaS:n}).
Значение данного слова очень похоже на {QaS:n:1h}, но включает в себя офицеров ({yaS:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: It is unclear why Federation Standard corrupted the spelling of this word by adding an extraneous {qaghwI':n}.
Неясно, почему язык Федерации исказил произношение этого слова, добавив лишний {qaghwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: bara, enbart, endast (kommer efter verb eller substantiv)

This follows the verb it modifies, and has the effect of trivializing the action.
This adverbial can also follow a noun, in which case it means "only" or "alone".

Это следует за глаголом, который он модифицирует, и имеет эффект упрощения действия.
Это наречие может следовать после существительного, и в этом случае это означает "только" или "в одиночестве".

table.name: mem
table.column:
When this is the verb in the second sentence of a sentence-as-object construction, neither {'e':n:pro} nor {net:n:pro} are used.[1]
Watch a lesson on this word: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/JyeePTUXVa8}

Когда этот глагол находится во втором предложении, в конструкции типа "предложение, как объект", ни {'e':n:pro} ни {net:n:pro} не используются.[1]
Смотрите урок по этому слову: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/JyeePTUXVa8}
The rule that {'e':n:pro} shouldn't be used has occasionally been violated in canon.

table.name: mem
table.column: The example Klingon sentence was presented to Marc Okrand by Chris Lipscombe. Okrand then translated it into English.
▶ {tlhIngan Hol neHHa' vIjatlh.:sen@@tlhIngan Hol:n, neHHa':adv, vI-:v, jatlh:v} "I speak not only Klingon", as in "I speak many languages including Klingon".
▶ {tlhIngan Hol neHHa' vIjatlh.:sen@@tlhIngan Hol:n, neHHa':adv, vI-:v, jatlh:v} "Я говорю не только на Клингонском", или "Я говорю на многих языках, включая Клингонский".

table.name: mem
table.column: جستجو کنید، جستجو کنید، جستجو کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
искать, производить поиски, ожидать кого-то, разыскивать
See the example for an illustration of the difference between this word and {Sam:v}.
Смотрите пример для иллюстрации разницы между этим словом и {Sam:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: (It is) a probe of ancient origin.
(این است) یک پروسه از منشاء باستانی است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
(Det är) en sond av gammalt ursprung. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
（它是）一個古老的深空探測衛星。

table.name: mem
table.column: مسابقه، جفت کردن، نقشه بر روی [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This might be used if fingerprints match up (see {nItlh Su'nIm:n} and {nItlh Su'nIm vem:n}).[1]
Grammatically, this verb works like {rur:v}. One can say {A nel B:sen:nolink} "B matches A", or {nelchuq A B je:sen:nolink} "A and B match each other".[2]
When used for objects which come in pairs, such as socks and gloves, the subject is one item of the pair, and the object is the other.[3]
Nell Carter was a regular panelist on the TV show "Match Game".

table.name: mem
table.column: کاملا مناسب است، کاملا مناسب است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This might be used for a piece in a jigsaw puzzle.
Wie das Stück in einem Puzzle.

table.name: mem
table.column: partner (for objects which come in matching pairs)
Gegenstück (eines von zwei gleichen Teilen in einem Paar)
par (para objetos que vêm em pares correspondentes)
This word is used to refer to the partner of objects which come in pairs, such as socks and gloves and the like.
Dieses Wort verwendet man für die Teile eines Paares wie Socken, oder Handschuhen usw.

table.name: mem
table.column: be mature, be grown-up, be adult
بالغ شود، بزرگ شود، بزرگ شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser maduro, ser adulto, ser crescido

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qaSDI' nenghep, qa' patlh chu' chav tlhIngan SuvwI'. poSDaq nIHDaq je QamtaHvIS SuvwI'pu'. chaH jojDaq yItnIS lopwI'. luchovmeH 'oy'naQmey lo'.:sen:nolink} "The Age of Ascension marks a new level of spiritual attainment by a Klingon warrior. The initiate must pass through a gauntlet of warriors who test him with painsticks."[2]

▶ {qaSDI' nenghep, qa' patlh chu' chav tlhIngan SuvwI'. poSDaq nIHDaq je QamtaHvIS SuvwI'pu'. chaH jojDaq yItnIS lopwI'. luchovmeH 'oy'naQmey lo'.:sen:nolink} "Возраст взросления знаменует новый уровень духовных достижений Клингонским воином. Посвященный должен пройти сквозь строй воинов, которые проверяют его с помощью жезлов боли."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Moroni Olsen was the voice of the Magic Mirror in Disney's "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This pronoun is used in a sentence-as-object construction when the second sentence has an indefinite third-person subject (i.e., "one" or "someone").
Sometimes, {'e':n:pro} with {-lu':v} is used instead of {net:n:pro,nolink}. It is not clear why at the moment.

Это местоимение используется в конструкции "предложение, как объект", когда второе предложение имеет неопределённый субъект третьего лица (например кто-то или некто).
Иногда, {'e':n:pro} вместе с {-lu':v} используется вместо {net:n:pro,nolink}. На данный момент не совсем ясно, по какой причине.

(using {X net Y:sen:nolink}) ▶ {qama'pu' DIHoH net Sov:sen:nolink} "One knows we kill prisoners."[1, p.66] ▶ {Qu'vaD lI' net tu'bej.:sen} "One certainly finds it useful for the mission."[1, p.66] ▶ {Duj ghajchugh pagh, beylI'vo' 'oH Daje' net chaw'.:sen:nolink} "If (the ship is) unowned, you may buy it from the Bank."[3] ▶ {vImuHlu' net wuqHa'!:sen}
(using {X 'e' Y-lu':sen:nolink}) ▶ {yInlu'taH 'e' bajnISlu'.:sen} "Survival must be earned."[2] ▶ {yay chavlu' 'e' bajnISlu'.:sen} "Victory must be earned."[2] ▶ {DIvI' rojmab qep ghanglu' 'e' nIDlu', 'ach taH qep.:sen:nolink} "Despite efforts to halt them, peace talks with Federation continue."[3] ▶ {Qang QanmeH yan 'ISletlh Damuv 'e' wIvlu'.:sen:nolink} "You are chosen to serve on the Yan-Isleth and protect the Chancellor."[3] ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu':sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v} "it is predicted that it will rain" (see {'aq:v})[4]

(Использование конструкции {X net Y:sen:nolink}) ▶ {qama'pu' DIHoH net Sov:sen:nolink} "Кто-то знает, что мы убьем заключенных."[1, стр.66] ▶ {Qu'vaD lI' net tu'bej.:sen} "Кто-то определенно найдёт это полезным для миссии."[1, стр.66] ▶ {Duj ghajchugh pagh, beylI'vo' 'oH Daje' net chaw'.:sen:nolink} "Если (корабль) никому не принадлежит, вы можете выкупить его у банка."[3] ▶ {vImuHlu' net wuqHa'!:sen}
(Использование конструкции {X 'e' Y-lu':sen:nolink}) ▶ {yInlu'taH 'e' bajnISlu'.:sen} "Выживание должно быть заслужено."[2] ▶ {yay chavlu' 'e' bajnISlu'.:sen} "Победа должна быть заработана."[2] ▶ {DIvI' rojmab qep ghanglu' 'e' nIDlu', 'ach taH qep.:sen:nolink} "Вопреки усилиям остановить их, мирные переговоры с Федерацией продолжаются."[3] ▶ {Qang QanmeH yan 'ISletlh Damuv 'e' wIvlu'.:sen:nolink} "Вы избраны для службы в Ян-Ислет и защиты канцлера."[3] ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu':sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v} "it is predicted that it will rain" (see {'aq:v})[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that the Klingon word for "ten thousand" is independent of the words for "ten" ({maH:n:2,num}) and "thousand" ({SaD:n}).
Заметьте, что клингонское слово для "десяти тысяч" не зависит от слов "десять" ({maH:n:2,num}) и "тысяча" ({SaD:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: myriad (a period of ten thousand years)
بی شمار (دوره ای ده هزار سال) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
miríade (um período de dez mil anos)
To indicate "tens of thousands of years ago" or "tens of thousands of years from now", {ret:n} and {pIq:n} are used in place of {poH:n}, respectively.[1]
Чтобы обозначить "десятки тысяч лет назад" или "десятки тысяч лет спустя", {ret:n} и {pIq:n} использованы в соответствующем месте {poH:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the body part above the knee or elbow. If it's necessary to make a distinction, this word can be preceded by {'uS:n} or {DeS:n:1}.
The Dutch word "boven" meaning "above" is found in the words for "thigh" and "upper arm", respectively "bovenbeen" and "bovenarm".

table.name: mem
table.column: type of pot with handles (used for food preparation)
نوع گلدان با دسته (برای تهیه غذا استفاده می شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en slags skål med handtag (används vid matberedning)
有帶把手的鍋類型（用於食物準備）
tipo de panela com alças (usada para preparação de alimentos)

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an everyday sarcophagus, which is strictly utilitarian.
Dies ist der Begriff für einen normalen, alltäglichen Sarg.
Maltz said that {nev'aQ:n:nolink} and {nebeylI':n:nolink} ({nev'aQ:n:nolink} more frequently) are used for some sort of flying coffins.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject of {nIb:v:nolink} are the things which are identical.[2]
The use of this verb does not suggest in what way the things are identical, except when it is used in the following construction.
This verb is used to express the concept that two things have the same amount of some quality, in a similar manner to {rap:v}, but with the connotation of preciseness. If the quality is a measurable one, the connotation is that the two things have exactly the same amount of that quality. See the example below.[3]

Субъектом для {nIb:v:nolink} являются вещи, которые идентичны.[2]
Использование этого глагола не дает намека, в чем вещи идентичны, за исключением, когда это используется в следующей конструкции.
Этот глагол использован, чтобы выразить идею, что две вещи имеют одинаковое качество, аналогично {rap:v}, но с указанием точности. Если качество является измеримым, точность состоит в том что две вещи одинакового качества. Смотрите примеры ниже.[3]
▶ {'ugh ro'qegh'Iwchab, nIb raHta'.:sen:nolink} "The racht is as heavy as the rokeg blood pie." (i.e., they are exactly the same weight)[3]
▶ {'ugh ro'qegh'Iwchab, nIb raHta'.:sen:nolink} "Рахт такой же тяжёлый, как кровавый пирог." (т.е они одинакового веса)[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: See also {lurgh:n} for other words related to spatial directions.
Смотрите также {lurgh:n} для других слов, связанных с направлениями в пространстве.

table.name: mem
table.column:
In slang, to "nick" something is to steal it.
A line which was cut from {Star Trek Into Darkness:src} reveals that the person who is stolen from is marked with {-vo':n}: {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Neil deGrasse Tyson is an American astrophysicist.

table.name: mem
table.column: Milk is seldom consumed by itself, but the milk of some creatures, such as the {targh:n}, is combined with other ingredients to create more complex drinks.[1, p.95]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is how Klingons might refer to a lump or block ({ngogh:n:nolink}) of Terran cheese.
Это то, как Клингоны могут упомянуть о куске или о бруске ({ngogh:n:nolink}) земного сыра.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Chinese name comes from the movie's subtitles.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Setze einen Kurs zu Nimbus III. Plan den Kurs.
設定航線前往祥雲三星球。
The prefix should have been {wI-:v} instead of {ma-:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Starship Enterprise has been dispatched to Nimbus III.
Man hat das Raumschiff Enterprise nach Nimbus III geschickt.
سازنده فضانورد به Nimbus III فرستاده شده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Starship Enterprise har skickats till Nimbus III. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Звездолёт Энтерпрайз был послан на Нимбус 3
企業號奉命前往祥雲三星球。
A Nave Estelar Enterprise foi despachada para Nimbus III.

table.name: mem
table.column: How much fuel do we have?
In {TKD p.170:src} and {CK:src}, this is given as "How much fuel do we have left?"

table.name: mem
table.column: This word describes an activity best translated using the verb "weave", some forms of which involve sticks called {Hut'Inmey tIq:n:nolink}.
MO revealed this word after being asked about the Klingon word for "knit", and despite defining it to mean "weave", it's fairly clear that it also applies to knitting and crocheting.

table.name: mem
table.column: To use such a device, one may {qIp:v}, {'uy:v}, or {ngaH:v} it, depending on the particular device. The hole punch will {ghID:v} the paper (or other material).

table.name: mem
table.column: Ada Lovelace wrote that the Analytical Engine "weaves algebraical patterns" (see {nIq:v}) in the manner of the Jacquard loom. Its software was written on punch cards (see {nIqDob:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a major software update (e.g., 2.x to 3.x).

table.name: mem
table.column: hindra, störa, avbryta, lägga sig i
препятствовать, мешать, быть помехой, вмешиваться куда-то, подрывать, разрушать

This is defined in {TKD:src} as "hinder, interfere" and in {TKDA:src} as "disrupt, interfere (with)".
"Trespassing vessel" was translated as {nISbogh Duj:n:nolink} in a deleted scene from the 2009 {Star Trek:src} movie.

▶ {labmeH 'evnagh Se' lo' tlhIngan QumwI'. janmey ngo' lulo'lu'DI' pIj jabbI'ID nISpu' woj.:sen:nolink} "A Klingon communicator sends a signal through subspace radio. Older models were susceptible to radiation."[3]

▶ {labmeH 'evnagh Se' lo' tlhIngan QumwI'. janmey ngo' lulo'lu'DI' pIj jabbI'ID nISpu' woj.:sen:nolink} "Клингонский коммуникатор посылает сигнал через подпространственный приемник. Более старые модели были восприимчивы к радиации."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is used only for the Klingon weapon. The more general term for a weapon of this type is {pu':n:1}.
Watch Gowron say {nISwI'mey:n@@nISwI':n, -mey:n}: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Aadh3qMs7Go}

Это слово использовано только для Клингонского оружия. Более общее определение для оружия данного типа {pu':n:1}.
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит {nISwI'mey:n@@nISwI':n, -mey:n}: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Aadh3qMs7Go}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is erroneously given as {nISwI' bej:n:nolink} in {KGT p.56,80:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: These are powerful disruptors mounted on a ship.
Это мощные дизрапторы, установленные на корабле.

table.name: mem
table.column: 破壞者手槍、手持破壞者 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: be plain, be pure, be uncorrupted, be unsullied
ساده باشد، خالص باشد، نباشید، نباشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara enkel, vara ren, vara okorrumperad, vara ofläckad
顯而易見、純潔、沒有腐敗、沒有被污染 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser claro, ser puro, ser incorrupto, ser imaculado
Purists are always picking "nit"s. Also, a "neat" alcoholic drink is one served without ice or mixer.

table.name: mem
table.column: alleine, einsam, auf sich selbst gestellt
в одиночестве, наедине, единственно, действовать в одиночку

table.name: mem
table.column: nIteb Qob qaD jup 'e' chaw'be' SuvwI'.
A warrior does not let a friend face danger alone.
Ein Krieger lässt einen Freund nicht allein der Gefahr entgegentreten.
یک جنگجو اجازه نمی دهد یک دوست به تنهایی خطر را به خطر بیندازد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En krigare låter inte en vän ensam fara. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Воин не позволит другу встретить опасность в одиночку.
戰士不會畀朋友獨自面對危險。
Um guerreiro não deixa um amigo enfrentar o perigo sozinho.

table.name: mem
table.column: رانندگی خود را به تنهایی انجام دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {nISwI':sen:nolink}: {cha' chang'engmey (telDaq lujomlu', nItebHa' lubaHlu'):sen:nolink} "Disruptor - 2 pairs (Wing Mounted, Fire Linked)[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word refers to any digit on the hand, including the thumb.
Klingon has five verbs corresponding to each of the {nItlh:n:nolink}: {Sen:v}, {SIq:v}, {qay:v}, {qew:v}, and {qan:v:2}. In addition, when referring to a child's thumb, {rIl:v:1} is used instead of {Sen:v}.
Correspondingly, the fingers are called {SenwI':n} ({rIlwI':n} if it belongs to a child), {SIqwI':n}, {qaywI':n}, {qewwI':n}, and {qanwI':n}.
See {SIq:v} for an explanation of the usage of these finger verbs.

Это слово относится к любому пальцу на руке, включая большой палец.
Клингонский язык имеет пять глаголов, соответствующих каждому из {nItlh:n:nolink}: {Sen:v}, {SIq:v}, {qay:v}, {qew:v}, и {qan:v:2}. В дополнении, когда упоминают о детском большом пальце, {rIl:v:1} использовано вместо {Sen:v}.
Соответственно, пальцы названы {SenwI':n} ({rIlwI':n} если они принадлежат ребенку), {SIqwI':n}, {qaywI':n}, {qewwI':n}, и {qanwI':n}.
Смотрите {SIq:v} для объяснения использования этих глаголов.
The verbs for the fingers come from names of the Finger Lakes in New York State.

table.name: mem
table.column: impressão digital (sulcos na ponta do dedo)

table.name: mem
table.column: Fingerabdruck (Bild das beim Berühren hinterlassen wird)
اثر انگشت (علامت گذاری به سمت چپ با لمس کردن) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fingeravtryck (markera vänster genom att trycka på) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a computer input device.

table.name: mem
table.column: flat end of a pigment stick
extremidade plana de um bastão de pigmento
The plural of this is {nItlhpachDu':n@@nItlhpach:n:2,-Du':n:suff}.[1, p.80]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть превосходящим, превосходить, быть высшего качества

table.name: mem
table.column: One of the designers of the {BoP:src} poster. See {bIl jo'rIj:n:name}.
Один из создателей {BoP:src} постеров. Смотрите {bIl jo'rIj:n:name}.
▶ {lu'oghta' nIylo roDIS bIl jo'rIj je:sen:nolink} "Designed By: Nilo Rodis & Bill George"
▶ {lu'oghta' nIylo roDIS bIl jo'rIj je:sen:nolink} "Создано: Нило Родисом и Биллом Джорджем"

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to something that seems to appear, but isn't really there. It does not refer to a ghost or spirit, and is quite different from {qa':n}.
This refers to a {Saarbrücken qepHom'a':src} participant named "Nima" who never showed up. Also, in German, "niemand" means "nobody".

table.name: mem
table.column: быть длинным, быть продолжительным, быть растянутым, быть очень длинным (длительность)

table.name: mem
table.column: See also {much:v:1} for the idea of "presenting" a gift to someone.
Смотрите также {much:v:1} для идеи "дарения" подарка кому-либо.

table.name: mem
table.column: See also {much:v:1} for the idea of "presenting" a gift to someone.
Смотрите также {much:v:1} для идеи "дарения" подарка кому-либо.

table.name: mem
table.column: Don't trust Yridians who bring gifts.
Vertraue keinem Yridianer, der Geschenke macht.
اعتماد نکنید Yridians که هدیه را. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Lita inte på Yridians som tar med presenter. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Não confie em Yridians que trazem presentes.
There is a grammatical error with this sentence. It should be {tIvoqQo':sen@@tI-:v, voq:v, -Qo':v} rather than {yIvoqQo':sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Dem Bones" is a spiritual song about the skeleton.

table.name: mem
table.column: This appears as {QeD patmey noch patmey je:n:nolink} "science and remote sensing systems".

table.name: mem
table.column: Contrast this with {veS:n}, which refers to the concept of warfare.[2, p.47]
Противопоставляется слову {veS:n}, которое относится к концепции ведения военных дейтсвий.[2, стр.47]
▶ {noH ghoblu'DI' yay quv law' Hoch quv puS.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: noH ghoblu'DI' yay quv law' Hoch quv puS.
In war, there is nothing more honorable than victory.
Im Krieg gibt es nichts ehrenvolleres als den Sieg.
در جنگ، چیزی شایسته تر از پیروزی نیست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
I krig finns ingenting mer hedervärd än seger. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
На войне нет ничего более почетного, чем победа
在戰爭中，沒有事比勝利更光榮的。
Na guerra, não há nada mais honroso que a vitória.
In war, there is nothing more honourable than victory.
На войне нет ничего более почетного, чем победа

table.name: mem
table.column: In the dialect of this region, toasts do not use special grammar, and the subject follows the verb in toasts just as they do in regular sentences (see {-jaj:v}).

This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} on p.26 and not in the glossary. It appears as {noHva'Dut:n:nolink} and not as {noHva'Dut Sep:n:nolink}, but it is implied that this is the name of a region (see {Sep:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: noH QapmeH wo' Qaw'lu'chugh yay chavbe'lu' 'ej wo' choqmeH may' DoHlu'chugh lujbe'lu'.
Destroying an empire to win a war is no victory, and ending a battle to save an empire is no defeat.
Ein Reich zerstören, um einen Krieg zu gewinnen, ist kein Sieg, und eine Schlacht zu beenden, um ein Reich zu schützen, ist keine Niederlage.
نابودی یک امپراتوری برای پیروزی در جنگ هیچ پیروزی نیست و پایان دادن به نبرد برای نجات امپراتوری هیچ شکستی نیست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Att förstöra ett imperium för att vinna krig är ingen seger, och sluta en strid för att rädda ett imperium är inget nederlag. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Уничтожение империи, для победы в войне, это победа, а окончание битвы, чтобы спасти империю, не поражение.
摧毀帝國贏得戰爭並非勝利，結束拯救帝國的戰鬥並非失敗。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Destruir um império para vencer uma guerra não é vitória, e terminar uma batalha para salvar um império não é derrota.

table.name: mem
table.column: مجوز، شواهد، گواهی نامه، مرجع، استناد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
權威、證據、證明、參考、引用 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The phrase "citation needed" is associated with Wikipedia. "Wiki" means "quick" ({nom:adv}) and "pedia" means "education, child-rearing" ({puq:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: vara rutten, vara murken, vara skämd
быть гнилым, быть прогнившим, быть протухшим, быть тухлым, быть разложившимся, быть нравственно испорченным

table.name: mem
table.column: There is a Klingon idiom, {nong; vulqangan rur}, which is meant ironically.
Есть Клингонская идиома, {nong; vulqangan rur}, которая имеет ироническое значение.

table.name: mem
table.column: "NOP" is a no-op, a computer command to do nothing.

table.name: mem
table.column:
In vulgar English slang, breasts are called "knockers".
It's probably a coincidence, but نوک is also the Persian word for "nipple".

table.name: mem
table.column: This word takes the suffix {-Du':n}, as it's an extension of the meaning of the anatomical term.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, norg (shark-like sea creature)
動物類型、諾格（鯊魚般的海洋生物） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tipo de animal, norg (criatura marinha do tipo tubarão)
There is an idiom, {naS; norgh rur@@naS:v, norgh:n, rur:v}.[1, p.132]
This word first appeared in the novel {Sarek:src} by A. C. Crispin, and was only confirmed to have come from Okrand when it appeared three years later in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: It was explicitly stated that this takes {-pu':n:suff}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: خوردن در دهان کوچک، کتک زدن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
äta i små munfullar, nafsa på
The use of this verb is derogatory (except for children and pets).
This is the Yiddish word for nibble, "nosh". It's also similar to the German verb "naschen".

table.name: mem
table.column: Chanel No. 5 was the first perfume launched by Coco Chanel. {noS:sen:nolink} both sounds like "nose" and looks like "No. 5", and {vagh:n:1} means "number five".

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {not jegh tlhIngan SuvwI'.:sen:nolink} "A Klingon warrior never surrenders."[2]
▶ {not jegh tlhIngan SuvwI'.:sen:nolink} "Клингонский воин никогда не сдается."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: No Klingon ever breaks his word.
Ein Klingone bricht nie sein Wort.
هیچ كلینگون كلمه ی خود را از بین نمی برد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ingen Klingon bryter någonsin sitt ord. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ни один Клингон не нарушит своего слова
克林崗沒有打破他的話。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: فقط احمق ها هیچ ترس ندارند [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: 克林崗人從不虛張聲勢。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Ich habe ihn/sie noch nie vorher gesehen.
من او را قبلا ندیده ام. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag har aldrig sett honom / henne innan. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Я никогда не видел его/её раньше

table.name: mem
table.column: یک پرنده بزرگ سیاه و سفید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
It is nowhere near as large as a {qa'rol:n}, which is really big.
This is a reference to "The Raven" by Poe.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also be used for things like a door or gate that opens and closes vertically, like a portcullis.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara föråldrad, vara förlegad, vara ur bruk, vara obsolet
быть устаревшим, быть отжившим, быть рудиментарным
▶ {notlh veS, 'a tugh manotlhchoH je maH.:sen} ▶ {notlh tonSaw'lIj.:sen} "Your fighting technique is obsolete."
▶ {notlh veS, 'a tugh manotlhchoH je maH.:sen} ▶ {notlh tonSaw'lIj.:sen} "Твоя техника ведения боя устарела."

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "Your fighting technique is obsolete."
Это идиоматическое выражение дословно значит "Твоя техника ведения боя устарела."

table.name: mem
table.column: notlh veS, 'a tugh manotlhchoH je maH.
War is obsolete, as we are in danger of becoming.
Der Krieg ist überholt, aber wir werden bald auch überholt sein.
جنگ منسوخ است، زیرا ما در معرض خطر تبدیل شدن هستیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kriget är föråldrat, eftersom vi riskerar att bli. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Война устарела, мы скоро будем в опасности
戰爭已經過時了，但我們面臨著危險的處境。
A guerra é obsoleta, mas corremos o risco de nos tornar.
The first part of this sentence, {notlh veS:sen:nolink}, appears on {KGT p.47:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть чужаком, быть пришельцем, быть иностранцем, быть чужим, быть посторонним

table.name: mem
table.column: быть знаменитым, быть известным, быть хорошо известным, быть прославленным
The definition in {TKD:src} has "well known" with a space instead of a hyphen.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to cultural or societal ancestors or forebearers (who are not necessarily related by blood). For a direct ancestor, see {'emrIgh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a period in paleontology more recent than {bov tIQ:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined as "ancient language" in the glossary of {KGT:src}, but glossed as "ancestors' language" on p.12.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction based on {no'QeD:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Pun: the smell of rotten ({non:v}) egg.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть подозреваемым в чем-то, быть подозрительным

table.name: mem
table.column: The joke is that the definition of this word is one which is suspect, since {nub:v} means "be suspect". Also, this word is before {nung:v} in {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: исследовать, проверять, обследовать, экзаменовать, опрашивать, освидетельствовать

table.name: mem
table.column: society; group of people with shared culture
Gesellschaft (Gruppe von Leuten mit gemeinsamer Kultur)
جامعه؛ گروهی از مردم با فرهنگ مشترک [AUTOTRANSLATED]
общество, группа людей с общей культурой
社會;一群有共同文化的人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sociedade; grupo de pessoas com cultura compartilhada
Do not confuse this with a society in the scholarly sense, which is called a {yej'an:n}.[3]
Не путать с обществом в научном смысле, для которого есть слово {yej'an:n}.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word was used in the title of a thesis in sociology, "Klingon as Linguistic Capital: A Sociologic Study of Nineteen Advanced Klingonists" {Hol Sup 'oH tlhIngan Hol'e'; wa'maH Hut tlhIngan Hol po'wI' nughQeD:sen:nolink}, by Yens Wahlgren. This usage was approved by MO.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction based on {nughQeD:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: jdn. die Fingerknöchel in den Kopf drehen
پیچ گوشتی را به سر کسی بچسبانید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
torcer a junta na cabeça de alguém

table.name: mem
table.column: This is influenced by the {Qotmagh Sep:n} pronunciation of {DuH:n}.
На это влияет произношением слова {DuH:n} в {Qotmagh Sep:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A {nuH bey':n:nolink} has one {betleH:n}, one {naQjej:n}, and one {ghop 'etlh:n}.[1]
There is also a picture of one on {TKW p.124:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Despite the English definition, this may not necessarily be plural in Klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: You have chosen your weapon, so fight!
Du hast deine Waffen gewählt, also kämpfe!
شما سلاح خود را انتخاب کرده اید، پس مبارزه کنید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du har valt ditt vapen, så slåss! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你選擇了你的武器，打啦！
Você escolheu sua arma, então lute!

table.name: mem
table.column: آنها ما را اسکن کرده اند؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word means "promote" both in the sense of increasing someone's rank and in the sense of advertising an activity or advocating for a cause.
Данное слово означает, как продвижение кого-то по рангу, так и рекламирование какой-то деятельности или поддержки с какой-то целью.

The "Friend of Maltz" certificates are considered by some to be non-canon (since it's unclear which parts of the text came from the KLI and which were provided by Marc Okrand), but the Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement (which was translated by Marc Okrand) uses {num:v:nolink} with the same meaning.

▶ {tlhIngan Hol Danummo' pIquvmoH.:sen@@tlhIngan Hol:n, Da-:v, num:v, -mo':v, pI-:v, quv:v, -moH:v} "Because you promote the Klingon language, we honor you."[2] ▶ {Danumlu'. Sa' Damoj.:sen@@Da-:v, num:v, -lu':v, Sa':n, Da-:v, moj:v} "Promoted to General."[3] ▶ {qum DuSaQmeyDaq 'Irghbe'meH ghotpu' nabmey ghojmoH, 'ej pIj tay'taH Doch pIm num.:sen:nolink} "In public schools, it teaches procedures so that people don't bully, and it promotes Infinite Diversity in Infinite Combinations."[4]

▶ {tlhIngan Hol Danummo' pIquvmoH.} "Из-за того, что ты продвигаешь Клингонский язык, мы чтим тебя."[2] ▶ {Danumlu'. Sa' Damoj.} "Продвинутый генералом."[3] ▶ {qum DuSaQmeyDaq 'Irghbe'meH ghotpu' nabmey ghojmoH, 'ej pIj tay'taH Doch pIm num.:sen:nolink} "В общих школах, это учит процедурам, чтобы людей не запугивали, и это пропагандирует бесконечное многообразие в бесконечных комбинациях."[4]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {matlh jupna':src}, [3] {Klingon Monopoly:src}, [4] {Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement:src} ({KLI mailing list 2016.11.30:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: предшествовать, предпосылать, стоять или идти перед
To refer to the preceding day, month, or year, consider using {Hu':n}, {wen:n}, and {ben:n:1}, respectively.
Чтобы упомянуть предшествующий день, месяц, или год, используются {Hu':n}, {wen:n}, и {ben:n:1}, соответственно.
While {nungbogh:v:nolink} precedes a noun, {veb:v:nolink} comes after one.

table.name: mem
table.column: A reverse combination of {Ham:v} "be high-pitched" and {ngun:v} "perch" (like a bird does). "High" + "bird" = "hybrid".

table.name: mem
table.column: MO confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src} that {nup:v:nolink} is intransitive.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word fits into a sentence in the place which would be occupied by the answer.[1] It works like a pronoun in questions with "to be" in the English translations.[2]
Questions in English often map more naturally to imperatives in Klingon. If you want to ask a "what" question, consider using a command with a verb such as {ngu':v} instead.[2] For example, consider {per:v}, {ja':v}, {Del:v}, etc.
Also, note that "What are your orders?" is expressed in Klingon as {chay' jura'?:sen} See {chay':ques}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Where do I put this? What do I do with this?
Wo stelle ich das hin? Was soll ich damit tun?
کجا می توانم این را بگذارم؟ چطوری با این کار کنم؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Var lägger jag det här? Vad gör jag med detta? [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Куда мне это положить? Что мне с этим делать?
我把它放在哪裡？我該怎麼辦？ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Onde eu coloco isto? O que eu faço com isto?

table.name: mem
table.column: 我在哪裡睡覺？我係邊度瞓?

table.name: mem
table.column: To ask where a person is, {ghaH:n} should be used instead of {'oH:n}. {nuqDaq ghaH ...'e'?:sen:nolink} "Where is ...?"
Чтобы спросить где находится человек, следует использовать {ghaH:n} вместо {'oH:n}. {nuqDaq ghaH ...'e'?:sen:nolink} "Где ...?

▶ {nuqDaq 'oH bIQ'a' HeH'e'?:sen} "Where is the beach?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH puchpa''e'?:sen} "Where is the bathroom?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH juHlIj'e'?:sen} "Where do you live? Where is your home?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH Qe' QaQ'e'?:sen} "Where is a good restaurant?"

▶ {nuqDaq 'oH bIQ'a' HeH'e'?:sen} "Где пляж?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH puchpa''e'?:sen} "Где ванная?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH juHlIj'e'?:sen} "Где ты живешь? Где твой дом?" ▶ {nuqDaq 'oH Qe' QaQ'e'?:sen} "Где хороший ресторан?"

table.name: mem
table.column: Where do you live? Where is your home?
Wo wohnst du? Wo ist dein Zuhause?
کجا زندگی می کنید؟ خانه شما کجاست؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Var bor du? Var är ditt hem? [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你住在哪裡？你家在哪裡？
Onde você mora? Onde fica sua casa?

table.name: mem
table.column: Watch a lesson on this phrase: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/EMipQm5JZgI}
Смотрите урок по этой фразе: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/EMipQm5JZgI}

table.name: mem
table.column: Where do you keep the chocolate?

table.name: mem
table.column: what did you say? huh? what?
o que você disse? Hã? que?
This is in clipped Klingon. The grammatical way to ask "What did you say?" would be {nuq Dajatlh?:sen@@nuq:ques, Da-:v, jatlh:v}
Является укороченным вариантом фразы {nuq Dajatlh?:sen@@nuq:ques, Da-:v, jatlh:v}

table.name: mem
table.column: Что тебе нужно? Что ты хочешь?

table.name: mem
table.column: In {CK:src}, the Klingon hotel clerk asks the Terran visitor, {nuq mI'lIj, tera'ngan?:sen:nolink} But this question works as well for telephone numbers as it does for hotel guest numbers.

table.name: mem
table.column: раздражать, мешать, препятствовать, беспокоить, тормошить, докучать, надоедать

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a Class M planet which is home to the {mughato':n}.
Название планеты класса "М", являющейся домом для {mughato':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Sie haben uns ohne Zweifel ausgetrickst!

table.name: mem
table.column: When this word is plural, it focuses more on the group as a whole rather than the individuals. So {nuvpu':n@@nuv:n, -pu':n} would probably be translated as "people" (rather than "persons"), but this is not a strict rule.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is often used of things that are smaller than the usual or expected size.
Made of two letters used as symbols for very small things. The letter "n" is an abbreviation for the prefix "nano", while "u" is often used instead of "μ" as an abbreviation for "micro".
